m1_issues_resolved.comment: Variable naming improved from 'themes'/'filtered_themes' to 'high_quality_themes'/'low_quality_themes'. Applied consistently across all uses (lines 388, 390, 392, 402, 443-444, 447, 449). Significantly improves code clarity and future maintainability.

other_round1_fixes_verified.description: Type annotations corrected from 'list' to 'List[dict]' and 'List[str]' in PipelineRun model
Warnings sanitized to remove conversation IDs - improves security

positive: Variable naming throughout is now clear and descriptive (type_counts, confidence_counts, seen_types, etc.)
Function docstrings are complete and informative
Type annotations are correct and comprehensive
Comments appropriately explain complex logic (e.g., lines 104-107 on falsy string handling)
Consistent patterns for dict access using .get() with defaults
Good use of structured data types (Counter, set for O(1) lookups)
Clear separation of concerns in function structure
minor_observations: Loop variable 'r' in _store_dry_run_preview (line 103, 136, 155) is brief but acceptable given context (represents classification result dict)
M2 and M3 from Round 1 not addressed, but these were marked as 'nice to have' / post-merge enhancements

summary: Round 2 verification complete. M1 variable naming fix has been applied consistently and correctly throughout the codebase. Additional Round 1 fixes (R1 type annotations, S1 security sanitization) also verified. No new maintainability issues detected. Code quality is solid with clear variable names, complete documentation, and proper error handling patterns. Ready for merge.
